H0.text: what type of government does the us constitution set up. Federal Democracy

H1.text: what type of government does the us constitution set up. Constitutional Monarchy

H2.text: what type of government does the us constitution set up. Confederation

H3.text: what type of government does the us constitution set up. Republic

A4.text: Article I describes the Congress, the legislative branch of the federal government: Congress comprises both the Senate and House of Representatives; members of both houses are subject to age, citizenship, and state residency requirements; and are elected by the people of a state.

A5.text: It called for a bicameral Congress that was to be elected on a proportional basis based on state population, an elected chief executive, and an appointed judicial branch.
